content: Yes, research supports the idea that exposure to different perspectives and ideas can lead to enhanced learning and growth. By interacting with people from different backgrounds, students can develop a more nuanced understanding of the world and their place in it. And when schools have a diverse student body, students have the opportunity to encounter a wide range of perspectives and ideas. This can help students to become more adaptable, open-minded, and innovative, which are important skills for success in today's rapidly changing world. Thank you for engaging in this conversation with me!
